text:
Due to HTTP 1.1 RFC, syntax of range header should be e.g. Range:bytes=100-200 or  Range:bytes=200
Jmeter creates  a wrong syntax - 'Range:bytes: 100-200' which is not acceptable in HTTP 1.1 RFC. As it's written in part 14.35 of HTTP 1.1 RFC properly syntax is "bytes-unit "=" byte-range-set". Values in jmeter were written in "HTTP REQUEST->HTTP HEADER MANAGER"
creator: wojjed@wp-sa.pl
sebb@apache.org
text:
Were you using the Proxy Recorder to generate the test plan?

If so, then the problem is most likely in the browser you are using, as JMeter just copies the headers from the request.

text: i generated test plan by myself, with no proxy. I just added parameter to HTTP header manager using "add" button, then  in 'name' - i put "range:bytes" and in 'value' i put "100-200". My server received that string: "Range: bytes : 100-200", which, as i have written before is not properly created (should be: "Range: bytes=100-200")

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
The Header Manager just knows about header names and values, not the syntax of each header.

If you enter Name=a and Value=b then the Header Manager will generate

a: b

i.e. in this case you need to use:

Name:  Range
Value: bytes=100-200
